name: UpdateGithubCodeScanningAlert
description:
Update the status of a GitHub code scanning alert.

This tool updates the status of a code scanning alert on a GitHub repository. It's useful when you need to manage alert statuses for security reasons. Requires appropriate access token scopes.

parameters.name: repository_owner
parameters.description: The account owner of the repository. This is case insensitive.

value_schema.description: The account owner of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: repository_name
parameters.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

value_schema.description: The name of the repository. The name is not case sensitive.

parameters.name: alert_identifier_number
parameters.description: The unique number identifying a GitHub code scanning alert, found at the end of the alert URL or in the response of the alerts list.

value_schema.description: The number that identifies an alert. You can find this at the end of the URL for a code scanning alert within GitHub, and in the `number` field in the response from the `GET /repos/{owner}/{repo}/code-scanning/alerts` operation.

parameters.name: alert_state
parameters.description: Specifies the new state of the code scanning alert. Use 'open' or 'dismissed'. Provide `dismissed_reason` if 'dismissed'.

value_schema.description: Sets the state of the code scanning alert. You must provide `dismissed_reason` when you set the state to `dismissed`.

parameters.name: dismissal_comment
parameters.description: The comment explaining the reason for dismissing the code scanning alert.

value_schema.description: The dismissal comment associated with the dismissal of the alert.

parameters.name: dismissed_reason_for_alert
parameters.description: Required if the alert state is dismissed. Specify the reason using one of: 'None', 'false positive', 'won't fix', 'used in tests'.

value_schema.description: **Required when the state is dismissed.** The reason for dismissing or closing the alert.
